bug.author: jameshensman
bug.summary: docs should include reference to GPLVM methods
bug.description:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/alexisboukouvalas>@alexisboukouvalas</denchmark-link> , You noted that the docs don't include a reference to the GPLVM yet, even though there is a notebook. The way to add the notebook to the docs is to modify doc/source/index.rst. It will be obvious how to add the notebook when you open the file :) You could also modify doc/source/intro.rst, thich contains some description of the project, and what's included. Suggest you update this also. To build the docs, install the dependencies <denchmark-code>pip install sphinx nbsphinx numpydoc </denchmark-code>
Then from the doc directory, type make html and the open doc/build/index.html Once the edits are pushed to master, they will appear automatically within a few minutes on readthedocs.org. If you'd like access to GPflow on readthedocs.org, which will let you automatically build docs on branches, make an account there and I will give you access. James.

comments.comment: I think this is a bug as intro.rst points to the GPLVM notebook.
